3.1 Create Load Balancer

Finally, we can create our Load Balancer. Click the menu button on top left. Scroll down to "Networking" and click "Load Balancers".{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/load_balancer_menu.png}} Click on Create Load Balancer button.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/create_load_balancer_button.png}}

Let's name the Load Balancer load_balancer {{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/load_balancer_config_1.png}}Select our VCN and set the Load Balancer Listener in the load_balancer_subnet.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/load_balancer_config_2.png}}Finally, add both of our backend servers into the backend set.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/load_balancer_config_3.png}}Hit the create button and we have our load balancer.

After the Load Balancer is fully provisioned, we can find its IP address in the information section.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/load_balancer_public_ip.png}}Copy and paste the IP address in your browser and visit the IP address, you will see the Load Balancer working and switching in between servers.{{img-url:/images/tutorials/jump_server_load_balancer/switch.png}}
